ARABIC: وَإِنِّى خِفْتُ ٱلْمَوَٰلِىَ مِن وَرَآءِى وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًا فَهَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: I fear my relatives when I am gone and my wife is barren, so give me an heir from You
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But I fear my relatives after me; and my wife is barren. So grant me a successor as a favour from You
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: I fear evil from my kinsmen after I am gone; and my wife is barren, so grant me an heir out of Your special grace,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I am afraid of what my kinsmen will do after (my death) and my wife is barren. Lord, grant me a son
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And I fear my relatives after me and my wife is barren therefore bestow upon me from Yourself one who will take up my work.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And verily, I fear Mawali after me, and my wife is barren. So give me from Yourself an heir."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And surely I fear my cousins after me, and my wife is barren, therefore grant me from Thyself an heir,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And now I fear my kinsfolk after I am gone; and my wife is barren. So give me, from Thee, a kinsman
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! I fear my kinsfolk after me, since my wife is barren. Oh, give me from Thy presence a successor
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: now I fear my kinsmen when I am gone. [I have no hope of their continuing my mission] for my wife is barren, so grant me a successor from Yourself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And verily I fear my kindred after me, and my wife hath been barren; so bestow on me from before Thee an heir.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed I fear my kinsmen, after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me from Yourself an heir
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after me: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And Verily! I fear my relatives after me, since my wife is barren. So give me from Yourself an heir,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, I fear my kinsmen who will succeed me, for my wife is barren. Grant me a kinsman
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “And I fear for my dependents after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me, from Yourself, an heir.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:5] And truly I fear my kinsfolk, namely, those who will succeed me [as closest after me] in kinship, such as [my] paternal cousins, after me, that is, after my death, [I fear] for the religion, lest they forsake it, as You have witnessed in the case of the Children of Israel, in the way that they changed [their] religion, and my wife is barren, she does not conceive. So grant me from Yourself a successor, a son,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! I fear my kinsfolk) i.e. the inheritors (after me) i.e. there is no one after me to inherit my office and position, (since my wife) Hannah the sister of the mother of Mary the daughter of Amran ('Imran) the son of Matthan (Mathan) (is barren) and gives birth to no children. (Oh, give me from Thy presence) from You (a successor) a son,
